title: Scene 3: Post-It Protocol
text:
The tablet cut your hand.
The nurse didn’t notice.
And now you’ve decided the only thing sharper than that tablet… is your pen.

You steal a stack of hospital Post-Its from the supply cart. They smell like antiseptic and resignation.

You find hiding places: under the keyboard, inside a vitals folder, behind the community whiteboard.
They’ll find them eventually. Maybe not today. But eventually.

You write what they won’t chart.

choices.result: You tuck it into a nurse’s pocket clipboard. She doesn’t notice until lunch.
It’s stuck to the crash cart. Right next to the Ativan drawer.

choices.text: “I vomited the trust out of me and you called it noncompliance.”
choices.result: You wedge it under the call button no one ever answers.

choices.text: “Nice chart. Shame if someone redlined the truth into it.”
choices.result: It’s folded into the incident report folder. The one that always stays blank.
You stick it to the inside of your own file. Just in case someone opens it again.
